exercise.pack.title: Exercises: On New Sequences from Given Ones

problem.para: About sequences (a_n) and (b_n) answer the following questions. If your answer is ‘yes’, prove it; if your answer is ‘no’ give examples of sequences for which the question has a negative answer.
If both (a_n) and (b_n) are increasing, is their sum (a_n + b_n) increasing?
If both (a_n) and (b_n) are increasing, is their product (a_n \cdot b_n) increasing?
If both (a_n) and (b_n) are monotone, is their sum (a_n + b_n) monotone?
If both (a_n) and (b_n) are monotone, is their product (a_n \cdot b_n) monotone?
If (a_n) is monotone, is every subsequence (a_{n_i}) monotone?
If (a_n) is alternating, is every subsequence (a_{n_i}) alternating?
If (a_n) is bounded below, is every subsequence (a_{n_i}) bounded below?
If (a_n) is monotone, is every rearrangement of (a_{n}) monotone?
If (a_n) is bounded above, is every rearrangement of (a_{n}) bounded above?
